p: The first Malaysian was confirmed with COVID-19 on the 4 th February 2020. The 41-year old man had recently returned from Singapore when he started to develop a fever and a cough. He was quarantined at Sungai Buloh Hospital, Selangor [ 24]. On the same day, a 4-year-old Chinese national girl who had been isolated at Sultanah Maliha Hospital, Langkawi, since the 29 th January 2020, had recovered, been discharged and was allowed to return to China [ 25]. In Malaysia, this was the first patient who had recovered from COVID-19 since the outbreak began.
